objective: Help student choose his career path

facts.text: Predicted 12th grades: Maths-C, Chemistry-D, Physics-D, English-C.
User is really good at chess and has played at higher levels.
User is really good at cricket and has played at higher levels.
Objective: Help student choose his career path.

decisions.text: Initial recommended country pathways: UK (Foundation Year/International Year One), Australia (Diploma/Pathway), Canada (College then transfer), New Zealand (Pathways), USA (only if strong sports profile + test scores + budget).
Suggested strategy: use foundation/diploma/pathway routes rather than direct entry into competitive STEM/engineering programs.

Suggested degree directions aligned with chess/cricket: sports management/business/event management; sports data/analytics via IT/business analytics pathway; business/marketing (sports marketing/sponsorship); coaching/sport science (less STEM-heavy); game design/esports management.

constraints.text: With current/predicted grades, direct entry to many top STEM/engineering programs is likely difficult; pathways recommended.

assumptions.text: Athletic recruitment/scholarships may be possible but depend on verified performance, academics, tests, and funding; cricket is niche in the USA.

definitions.definition: Alternative entry route to a degree when direct entry requirements are not met; includes foundation years, diplomas leading into year 2, or college programs that transfer to university.

open_loops.question: Which curriculum are the grades from (IGCSE/GCSE, CBSE, IB, etc.)?
What is the user's citizenship and current country of residence?
What is the user's annual budget (tuition + living) and whether scholarship is needed?
Preferred intake timing (e.g., 2026 Sep or earlier)?
What does the user want to study right now (pick 2: business, IT, sports management, media, hospitality, other)?
Does the user want a sports-related career or a non-sports career using sports as an admissions strength?
Can the user provide a sports profile pack (match stats, rankings/titles, certificates, highlights video, coach references) to support applications?
